content.description:
A good route, that has a little more character then its neighbor Waterhole. A short thin step is followed by either a thin pillar of a couple of body lengths or rock moves protected by a bolt. Then continue to a bolted anchor on low angled ice.

Located at the far West end of McGillivary Slabs.  Park at a small pullout in the trees just before the guardrail starts when heading Eastbound on Hwy 1.  At the south end of the parking area locate a trail heading into the trees. Follow the trail until it crosses a bigger trail, turn right here and continue for a short distance until it breaks off left. Head up hill until you reach Irish Mist.
Bolted anchor

An excellent multipitch sport climb on pretty darn good rock. A short approach make this a good route to do if in the area and looking for something longer than can be found in Heart Creek. Approach: Walk up the approach trail to the base of the slabs, and naturally follow the trail right. Morning Side starts about 40m right of the cave opening on the trail. Walk past the cave until you hit a short 4m tall pillar that the trail skirts around. This is the start of the climb, look for bolts that head up. It's follows the face just right of Kahl Crack.

Descent: walkoff to the right or rap the route if no one is under you. Rap from P4 to P3, then P3 to P1 (58m rope stretcher), then P1 to the dirt. 10 draws, 3 long slings, 60m ropes

Don't let the grade scare you for this climb! Easy to link pitches together. 70m is needed for rappelling, tie knots in the end. If linking pitches, 22 draws will be needed if clipping all the bolts. 

P1: 5.10 a/b 35m

P2: 5.10a/b 32m

P3: 5.10b 35m; traverse to the left around the roof

P4: 5.10b 35m

P5: 5.10b 32m

P6: 5.10b/c or 5.11b/c 35m; 5.10b/c option climb the wider crack for 3 bolts then move rightward across the slabs; 5.11b/c option climb directly up the slab past the tricky undercling section

P7: 5.9 35m 

P8: 5.10a/b 35m

P9: 5.10b/c or 5.11b/c 35m; 5.10b/c option after the first 3 bolts traverse left and use the arete to help with the slab; 5.11b/c option after the first 3 bolts traverse right directly on the slab 

P10: 5.4 25m do this pitch if choosing the walk off option, otherwise skip this if rappelling, there are no rap rings

Descent options:

Rappel option (recommended!!!): 70m rope required

Walk-off option (slightly more complicated): walk off to the west along the top of McGillivary slabs. There is no defined trail. Continue west walking down steep terrain to connect small rock ridges until possible to descend at the western terminus of McGillivary Slabs where there should be a faint trail, eventually reaching the main base of the trail. Head east back to the parking lot



Park at Heart Creek Trail head. Head west on a trail that runs somewhat parallel to the highway until you reach the power lines at redirect in the power lines; this will be about 10 or so minutes from the parking lot. From this point, head up hill for 20m to find a faint trail (there is an orange marker to indicate the beginning of the trail). The trail follows alongside the creek for the most part but do not descend into the creek until about 100m from entering the base of the big bowl. Take a steep path down and walk in the creek bed until reaching a small scree on the right/west side of the gully. Scramble up for about 30m to the base of the climb. Approach takes around 40-60 minutes. 

Bolts, anchors with rap rings at each pitch

No bolts or pitons, links slabs and corners with treed ledges. Lots of 15-metre run outs and traversing to break through roofs. 

P1: From base of buttress head up slab to roof. Get a good .75 and traverse right to trees (5.8R 25m).

P2: Head up trees to right-facing corner and left on ledge (5.5 60m)

P3: Up hand crack to finger crack and ledge. Up right-facing stem corner to roof. Pull the bulge out and left to mossed up crack to trees (5.9 50m).

P4: Up slab to right to scoop and left to pull small roof. Sling bush and up 20m with no pro to trees (5.8R 40m).

P5: Up slab and right along roof with nice crack to treed ledge (5.7R 25m).

P6: Bushwhack up left to slab and long left traverse on grassy slab (5.4 50m)

P7: Up scoop with cracks wrastlin' trees (5.6 25m).

Descent: Walk right to climber's descent.



Far left side of wall.

Single rack, 60m rope

Left most route out of the 2 ice climbs.  A good route if you are looking for a short approach. The climbing is pretty easy and the views are a little industrial.

Located at the far West end of McGillivary Slabs.  Park at a small pullout in the trees just before the guardrail starts when heading Eastbound on Hwy 1.  At the south end of the parking area locate a trail heading into the trees. Follow the trail until it crosses a bigger trail, turn right here and continue for a short distance until it breaks off left. Head up hill until you reach Irish Mist. To reach Waterhole, locate a trail that heads up and left (East)
Bolted anchor at the top of the route

McGillivray Slabs are North facing and just a hair west of Heart Mountain and before Dead Man's Flat. Located just East of Canmore. The slabs have a short 15 minute approach and several moderate climbs on solid rock. Reminiscent of Kid Goat, but more friction climbing. Several 4 pitch bolted sport routes and a few easy trad routes (Kahl Crack). Worth a visit on a short day.  
  
 The downside is the highway noise and looking at the quarry across the lake.  There are certainly worse views out there though. 
  
 Routes from climbers Left to Right: 
 Gollywog (5.7R, 240m, 7 pitches, Howe & C. Smith, 1971) 
 Pythagoras (5.7 270m, 7 pitches, R. Howe, J. Martin & J. White, 1971) 
 Pixie (5.6, 7 pitches, R. Howe & J. Martin, 1971) 
 Imagination 
 Tony's Route (5.5, A. Shaw & F. Williamson, 1969) 
 McGillivraneering (5.9, 200m+, FA: Brandon Pullan 2005 rope-solo) 
 7-Up (5.7, First ascent party unknown) 
 Rubble Without a Cause (5.5, 95m, G. Powter & D. Chandler, June 1983) 
 Hiatus (5.8 70 m 2 pitches, B. Wyvill and G. Powter, June 1985) 
 Pitter Patter (5.8 6 pitches?, I. Stewart-Patterson & M. Toft, 1982) 
 Overhang Route (5.7?, B. Davidson & L. Drews) 
 Taiga (5.7, 170m FA: Brandon Pullan, June 2005, rope-solo) 
 Raspberry Ramble 
 Dirty Boys 
 Kahl Crack (5.6, 200 m, H. Kahl & party, circa 1965) 
 Morningside  (5.7, 4 pitches) 
 Student's Route (5.5, A. Derbyshire & party, 1980) 
 Faye 
 and several others I haven't found info on yet
